intro: Cynoglossum amabile f. leucanthum, commonly known as the white hound's tongue, is a cultivar of the species Cynoglossum amabile, characterized by its distinctive blue to white flowers. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is native to Europe, particularly the British Isles. The plant features broad, tongue-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and have a woolly texture. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and unique foliage.
